Rishikesh Holiday Packages

Rishikesh or the “Gateway to Garhwal Himalayas”, is the Yoga Capital of the world. Located in the foothills of the Himalayas, Rishikesh invites travelers and tourists from all around the world to admire the beauty of the place. The Rishikesh sightseeing packages facilitate the travelers to enjoy the plethora of activities and sightseeing that Rishikesh provides.

Encompassing forested hills, dense vegetations, the holy Ganges River, and numerous ashrams, Rishikesh is a blissful abode of spiritual seekers. The rumbling music of Ganges accompanied by the delicious breeze of the Himalayas amid an inspiring lush green landscape reflects the sheer charm of this place. Be prepared to find yourself in this scenic city of Uttarakhand.

15 Best Places To Visit In Rishikesh Tour Package

The Rishikesh tourism package not only provides you with the best deals but also helps you to indulge in all the adventure activities and sightseeing. Accommodate at the best hotels, attend the auspicious evening aarti, shop to your heart’s content, and relish the beauty of the Yoga Capital. Therefore, these tour packages for Rishikesh include a detailed itinerary that provides all sorts of facilities to travelers. Apart from sightseeing, and outdoor activities, these itineraries also include comfortable accommodations, and local transfers so that travelers are treated to utmost comfort. Our travel experts specially design these itineraries so that tourists can enjoy a planned, and organized vacation.

Following are the tourist’s spots, one must ensure in their Rishikesh packages

1. Ram Jhula &Laxman Jhula

What’s Special: Swarg Ashram with Shivananda Ashram area.

Nearby Attractions: Sivananda Ashram, Bharat Mandir

Distance From City Center: 2.7 km

Transportation Options: Bus or private taxi.

Ram Jhula and Laxman Jhula are 450 feet long iron suspended bridges, also known as ‘the swinging bridge’. Nearly 4 km away from Rishikesh railway station, these swings are famous pilgrim spots. One can also visit the Trayambakeshwar temple, Ram temple and laxman temple, located in the vicinity. Also, holiday tour packages for Rishikesh provide you guided sightseeing for the tour.

2. Neelkanth Mahadev Temple

What’s Special: Dedicated to Neelkanth

Nearby Attractions: Khargosha

Timings: 5 AM to 6 PM

Distance From City Center: 25.3 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Taxi, Car

One of the most sacred Shiva shrines in India, Neelkanth Mahadev Temple is situated at 1670 metres in Sylvan forest. The tomb inside the temple, depicts the Samudra Manthan which attracts thousands of tourists.

3. Neer Garh Waterfall

What’s Special: Scenic Beauty

Nearby Attractions: Kriya Yoga Ashram

Timings: 8 AM to 6 PM

Distance From City Center: 7.9 km

Transportation Options: Walking, Taxi, Car

Merely two kilometres from laxman Jhula, Neer Garh Waterfall will surely entice you with its mesmerizing beauty. If you love photography, don 't dare to miss this waterfall!

4. Jumpin Heights

What’s Special: Adventure Activity

Nearby Attractions: Triveni Ghat

Timings: 9:30 AM to 4 PM

Distance From City Center: 21.1 Km

Transportation Options: Cab

If you love adventure then don 't forget to visit one of the most popular spots of Rishikesh, Jumpin Heights. It offers numerous activities such as bungee jumping, flying fox, giant swings and a lot more.

5. Swarg Ashram

What’s Special: Oldest Yoda Ashrams in Rishikesh

Nearby Attractions: Ran Jhula, Geeta Vhawan

Timings: 9 AM to 8 PM

Distance From City Center: 13.9 km

Transportation Options: Cab

If you are interested in meditation then Swarg Ashram, the oldest ashram of India, can be a good stop! Its located in isolated river bank and one can admire the panoramic and mystic beauty of Rishikesh here.

6. Gita Bhawan

What’s Special: One of the ancient shrine complexes in Rishikesh

Nearby Attractions: Triveni Ghat, Neer Garh Waterfalls

Timings: 7 AM to 9 PM

Distance From City Center: 14.4 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Gita Bhawan is a huge complex located on the banks of the Ganga River in the foothills of the Himalayas. The place is also famous as Guru Shri Ram Daasji and is a famous ashram in Rishikesh. The ashram is a famous Hindu institution as it is home to sacred book Geeta. The Bhavan is visited by many people for religious purposes as well as by tourists. Each year Hindu pilgrimages come here to take a holy bath in the river Ganga.

7. Triveni Ghat

What’s Special: Sacred Ghat

Nearby Attractions: Gita Bhawan

Timings: 5 AM to 6 PM

Distance From City Center: 600 m

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Another popular place to visit in Rishikesh is Triveni Ghat. It is situated on the banks of the sacred river Ganga and is the biggest ghat in Rishikesh where you can witness Maha Aarti every day in the evening. Triveni Ghat plays an important role in Hindu mythology as the place has been talked about in religious books such as Mahabharat and Ramayan. The Ghat is popular for holy dips and devotees from all over the world come here and make offerings to the river.

8. Vashishta Gufa

What’s Special: Ancient cave

Nearby Attractions: Patna Waterfalls, Shiv Gauri Pashmina World

Timings: 7 AM to 6 PM

Distance From City Center: 25 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Vashishta Gufa is an ancient cave and makes for an amazing weekend destination. Listed among the top places to visit in Rishikesh, it is a perfect blend of serene and peaceful vibes and attracts thousands of tourists from around the world.

9. Kunjapuri Temple

What’s Special: Serene surroundings and scenic views all around.

Nearby Attractions: Shri Badrinath Ji Temple, Scorpion Handicrafts

Timings: Open 24 hours

Distance From City Center: 26.5 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

A 30 minutes drive from Rishikesh, Kunjapuri Temple is one of the best places to visit in Rishikesh. If you want to witness the most mesmerizing sunrise in Rishikesh, this is the place to go. Plan an early morning trek to the top of the temple and witness the amazing sunrise view that will allure you with its beauty.

10. Tera Manzil Temple

What’s Special: A peaceful environment with a soothing aura

Nearby Attractions: Lakshman Jhula Bridge, Scorpion Handicrafts

Timings: 6 AM to 7 PM

Distance From City Center: 14.3 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Dedicated to multiple deities, Tera Manzil Temple is among the best religious places to visit in Rishikesh. Serene location, calm vibes, and splendid architecture perfectly sum ups this temple. On your trip to Rishikesh, do spend some time here for peaceful vibes.

11. Rishikund

What’s Special: Ancient pond

Nearby Attractions: Laxman Jhula, Ram Jhula

Timings: Open 24 hours

Distance From City Center: 900 m

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Rishikund is an ancient pond, dedicated to Lord Rama and Goddess Sita. With sacred water amid serene surroundings, Rishikund is located near the Raghunath Temple. The place is oozing with tranquility and is surrounded by dense vegetation of large trees.

12. Parmarth Niketan

What’s Special: Largest ashram in Rishikesh

Nearby Attractions: Ram Jhula, Madhuban Ashram

Timings: 9 AM to 8 PM

Distance From City Center: 14.3 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Founded by Swami Shukhdevanand Saraswati in the year 1942, Parmarth Niketan is the largest ashram in Rishikesh. One of the top yoga centers in the country, this place provides accommodation to visitors along with a plethora of rejuvenation facilities, including Ayurvedic treatments, music therapy, etc.

13. Byasi

What’s Special: Paradise-like surroundings, encompassing lush greenery and a serene environment.

Nearby Attractions: Vashishta Gufa, Jumpin Heights

Distance From City Center: 35.2 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Surrounded by Sal forest, Byasi is a small village located near Rishikesh. With the Ganges River flowing amidst the sprawling landscape of this village, tourists enjoy a number of adventure activities, including river rafting and camping. The village open-heartedly welcomes visitors and offers a multitude of accommodation options.

14. Kaudiyala

What’s Special: Plethora of adventure activities, including river rafting and rappelling

Nearby Attractions: Lansdowne, Pauri

Distance From City Center: 41 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Located near Rishikesh, Kaudiyala is a small village and an ideal place for adventure lovers. Brimming with exhilarating activities such as river rafting amid the most challenging belts of the Ganges River, this place is perfect for thrill-seekers. Apart from river rafting, one can also enjoy rock climbing, rappelling, trekking, and camping.

15. Muni Ki Reti

What’s Special: Encompasses various temples, ashrams, and yoga centers

Nearby Attractions: Garhwal Adventure, Madhuban Ashram

Distance From City Center: 5.6 km

Transportation Options: Bus, Cab

Home to a plethora of temples, ashrams, and meditation centers, Muni Ki Reti is a small town located near Rishikesh. Considered as the land of the sages, this place has a lot of ancient history attached to it. The town is a hub for those who seek solace and tranquility.

How To Reach Rishikesh?

Rishikesh, the gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas is well-connected to the major cities of India. Following are the travel options available to reach Rishikesh

By Air

The nearest airport to Rishikesh is Jolly Grant Airport, Dehradun which is 35 kilometre away from Rishikesh. Numerous airlines such as Air India, Spice Jet, Jet Airways, and IndiGo have daily flights for Jolly Grant Airport from Delhi. The runway of the airport is being extended further and soon the airport will be connected to other states as well! The second nearest airport to Rishikesh is in New Delhi. If you are coming by air, check for our cab transfers included in the Rishikesh vacation packages.

By Train

Rishikesh railway station is connected to Haridwar but welcomes only three trains daily. However, Haridwar is well-connected to the entire peninsula and attracts travellers and pilgrims from across the world. If you are planning a Rishesh Tour and willing to travel via train, then it 's recommended to deboard the train at Haridwar and take an auto rickshaw or bus to Rishikesh.

By Bus

There are numerous buses for Rishikesh from Delhi and other metropolitan cities. A bus journey from Delhi will take about 5-7 hours, depending on the traffic. Its recommended to take a late night bus from Delhi which will drop you at Rishikesh by 6-7 am.

By Car

If you enjoy long drives then travelling to Rishikesh via car or taxi could be exciting for you. Departing early morning from Delhi will make you reach Rishikesh before lunchtime.

Best Time To Visit Rishikesh

The best season to visit Rishikesh is the winter season, which is ideal for rafting and other water sports activities. However, a favorable climate prevails throughout the year. If one wants to enjoy a peaceful vacation then book our Rishikesh holiday tour packages in the month of March through June. Usually, the place is deserted in these months due to the summer season. July to September would be an ideal season for all the monsoon lovers to enjoy the showers. However, river rafting in Rishikesh is closed in the monsoon season. The best time to enjoy whitewater rafting and bungee jumping is from October through May. During this period, nature lovers can also enjoy hiking, camping, swimming, jungle treks, and other activities.

                Amazing Travel Stories By Our Travelers

                1. Ishpreet Kaur: Our adventurous Holi celebration at Rishikesh!

                5 Adventure Activities One Can Include In Rishikesh Packages

                Rishikesh is one of the most visited places in North India. The destination is famous for the many yoga ashrams that are found here and also the several adventure activities that can be indulged in. Rishikesh is a perfect destination to head to if you are craving for a bit of adventure in your life. There are several things people can get engaged in and the top ones are mentioned below.

                1. Bungy Jumping

                Bungy Jumping is the most thrilling activity that one can get indulged in. There are several spots in Rishikesh where people can try this activity. Each site’s drop is different hence people can decide depending upon how much of a daredevil you are. Some of the top sights are Mohanchatti and Jumpin Heights.

                2. Camping

                Another popular activity to get indulged in Rishikesh is camping. There are many camping locations in Rishikesh and each one of them provides something different when it comes to experience. Stay in tents out in the wild and have a fun time with friends.

                3. Trekking

                There is no better way to explore the wilderness of Rishikesh then by trekking. There are a lot of places where one can go on their own or join a group that will take you to some of the most offbeat places in Rishikesh.

                4. Hiking

                There are several hiking trails in Rishikesh that are full of some of the most beautiful landscapes and experiences. Some of the hikes are short while some are very long and intense. People can choose as per their fitness level and have a great time.

                Though, the above picture seems alluring, after the recent floods people are still skeptical if they can opt Kerala for their next tour?

                5. River Rafting

                River rafting is one of the main reasons for adventure enthusiasts to come to Rishikesh. Often river rafting is included in the package of camping. The rafting stretch varies from 9 to 16 to 25 km and also depends upon various levels of difficulty.

                Best Places To Stay In Rishikesh

                Rishikesh has ample accommodation options, varying from 5-star hotels to luxury cottages, tourists are offered a wide spectrum to choose from. To enjoy the soul-soothing refreshing nature of Rishikesh, one can opt for camping along the banks of River Ganges. There are also some top-tier luxury hotels for a remarkable stay, some of them are:

                1. Aloha On The Ganges

                Star Category: 3-Star

                Starting Price (Per Night): INR 3819* per person

                Location: NH 58, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand

                Favourably located on the banks of Ganges River, Aloha On The Ganges is an elegant property in Rishikesh. Offering an array of premium facilities, including a spa and yoga classes it is one of the most sought after stays in the city.

                2. The Narayana Palace by Salvus

                Star Category: 3-Star

                Starting Price (Per Night): INR 3136* per person

                Location: Badrinath Road, Tapovan, near laxman jhula, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand

                Located near Lakshman Jhula, The Narayana Palace by Salvus is an upscale property offering a wholesome soul-soothing atmosphere. With lush green landscapes encompassing this property, one is certain to have a blissful experience in Rishikesh.

                3. Divine Resort

                Star Category: 3-Star

                Starting Price (Per Night): INR 5712* per person

                Location: Laxman Jhula Rd, near Church, Tapovan, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand

                Overlooking the Ganges River, Divine Resort offers a spectacular view of the city. With a spa and an exquisite restaurant, this resort is one of the best stays in Rishikesh.

                What To Eat In Rishikesh?

                The cuisine of Rishikesh is quite diverse and carries rich flavors. While a couple of meal plans might be added in the Rishikesh trip packages, many food items are still left for your to discover in the city. Following is the list of street foods you must munch while holidaying in Rishikesh

                1. Samosa

                It 's a deep fried snack, stuffed with mashed potatoes. Samosa is the most preferred breakfast in Rishikesh which is served with tangy tamarind and mint sauce.

                2. Sweets

                As Rishikesh is frequently visited by pilgrims, a huge variety of sweets made of pure ghee is available at market places. One must surely try besan ki barfi, nariyal barfi, besan laddu and chamcham at rishikesh.

                3. Poori sabzi

                The traditional breakfast of north India, Poori sabzi, is no different in rishikesh. Fried bread served with spicy potatoes.

                4. Pani Puri

                These are crispy wheat gram pockets filled with spiced water, mashed potatoes and boiled chickpeas. Pani puri is believed to be India’s favourite street food.

                5. Chole Bhature

                Often eaten as a breakfast dish, Chole Bhature combined with chickpeas gives the best taste. The dish is often paired with a glass of lassi. There are several outlets sharing this delicious dish in Rishikesh.

                Things to Carry on Rishikesh Trip

                These are the Top Things One Should Carry to Rishikesh.

                • If one decides to go for river rafting then eyeglass straps are a must.
                • Carry sunblock since you would be spending a lot of the time out in the sun.
                • Lip balm is another important thing to carry to Rishikesh to protect them from strong sun rays.
                • Since a lot of walking would be happening, make sure you are carrying comfortable shoes.
                • Another important thing to carry if you are heading to Rishikesh for river rafting is carrying a waterproof Camera.
                • Lastly, always carry a First aid kit in case of emergencies.

                Safety Measures To Be Taken In Rishikesh

                • If planning to go for rafting, dress in comfortable outfits and do not carry
                • Be a little vigilant.
                • Carry mosquito repellent.
